column4: hey guys, quick question... how do I locate my dvd-rom drive so I can turn it's DMA on?
'cause, quite simply, I can't find it
dmesg|grep hd
assuming it's an ide drive
SCSI, okay
Well, it's an IBM
if it really is scsi, it probably doesn't need dma turning on
The problem is really with my DVD play back... it sucks. Heaps of artifacts, it's really slow... and that's the only solution I'm reading on the boards.
that sounds more like a cpu power or video drivers thing
Do the fglrx drivers mess up DVD playback?
i've not heard of any problems, but i don't use them myself
Well, alright... but how do I find where my dvd drive is located on my system?
if scd0 is correct, /dev/scd0 will be the device file for it
Alright, and I should not be able to access it like it was a directory, right? I have to mount it first, right?
you can already read files from the drive?
and when the dvd is "playing" I keep getting errors that "main decoder error: decoder is leaking pictures, resetting the heap"
i've not seen that message before, but i don't use vlc or those glx drivers
but it does sound like it's whatever is doing the mpeg decoding
Alright, just as long as it's not the drive I can work on it. Thanks for the help!
Got it, just downgraded my libdvdcss
ahh. glad it's fixed. odd that downgrading made it work better though
Yeah, to most of my problems lately downgrading has worked. Particularly with wine, of all things.
